actions.text: Referred to Senate Committee on the Judiciary.

official_title: A bill to establish a National Court of Appeals.

summary.text: National Court of Appeals Act - Establishes a National Court of Appeals composed of a chief judge and six associate judges appointed by the President, by and with the advice and consent of the Senate. Provides for the tenure and salary of such judges. Provides for the sessions of such National Court. Provides for the employment of a clerk, law clerks, librarian, marshal, bailiffs, and other personnel of such National Court. Sets forth the jurisdiction and power of review of such National Court. Provides that the National Court shall have jurisdiction of cases referred to it by the Supreme Court. States that such National Court shall have jurisdiction of any case filed or instituted in a court of appeals, the Court of Claims, and the Court of Customs and Patent Appeals, upon transfer of such case to it by any such court. Makes decisions by the National Court binding on all courts of the United States unless modified or overruled by the Supreme Court. Authorizes appropriations of necessary sums to carry out this Act.

titles.title: A bill to establish a National Court of Appeals.
